description.p: You cover yourself in a spectral suit of plate. You are considered proficient with this armor and do not have to meet a strength requirement. While active this spell adds your Intelligence modifier to your AC.
This effect does not stack with medium or heavy armor.

setters.set: an ingot of iron or better quality metal

description.p: You can cast this spell on a successful melee attack hit. When you cast this spell you make an additional melee attack against that target but the attack has a -2 penalty applied.

This spell can be cast using spells slots of 5th, 7th, or 9th to add one additional attack each but for each increase in spell slot an additional -1 is applied. I.e. if casted as a 9th level spell you would make 4 extra attacks with a -2,-3,-4, and -5 respectively.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Draconic Might Before you take your attack action on your turn with this weapon you can use a bonus action to declare one of the following damage types: lightning, fire, acid, poison, or cold. Your attacks with this weapon for the rest if this turn deal an additional d8 of your chosen damage type on top of the weapons normal damage. If your attack target is draconic this weapon ignores resistances but not immunities
When an ally you can see within 5 feet of you is targeted for an attack you can use your reaction to apply a +3 bonus to their AC until the end of their next turn.
When you make a sucessful melee wepon attack you can cast this spell. You add 1d8 psychic damage to the melee weapon damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 for each additional spell slot level used.

When you make a sucessful melee weapon attack you can cast this spell as a bonus action. you add 2 addtional d4 force damage to the attack, the shield spell can be cast as a reaction to negate the force damage..
This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level over first used for casting.

When you make a sucessful ranged weapon attack or thrown weapon attack you can cast this spell as a bonus action. the projectile leaps from the creature it struck to another hostile creature of your choosing with in your INT mod x5 feet, that creatures takes 1d4 poison damage and must make a sucessful constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure that target is poisoned until the end of their next turn.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d4 for each higher level spellt slot used when casting.

When you make a sucessful melee weapon attack you can cast this spell as a bonus action. When you cast this spell you can add 2d8 additional to damage to the weapon attack damage, you pick fire, lightning, cold, acid, or poison for the damage type.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot of a higher level used for the casting.
When you make a sucessful melee weapon attack you can cast this spell as a bonus action. you add 1d8 radiant damage to the weapon attack damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 for spell slot of a higher level used for casting.
When you make a sucessful melee weapon attack you can cast this spell as a bonus action. you add 1d8 necrotic damage to the melee weapon attack.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when spell slots of higher levels are used for the casting.

element.name: Water Stride
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Artificer, Druid, Ranger, Bard

description.p: When you cast this spell you cause your weight to become similar to that of silk, you become light enough to walk on water for 10 minutes.

You can cast this spell as a reaction only when you fall from a height of 15 feet or more. You conjure forth a parachute made from a silky like substance akin to that of spider web, the chute allows you to make a DC 13 dexterity save with advantage. On a failed save you take half of the normal fall damage you would've taekn otherwise and on a sucessful save you take no fall damage and land in a manner of your choosing.

setters.set: a strand of spider silk at least 8 inches in length

description.p: When you cast this spell you gain the ability to speak to spiders or any similar creatures (i.e. fiends or abjurrations assuming the form of a spider).

setters.set: a deceased spider to be consumed by the caster.

description.p: When you cast this spell you conjure forth a spear like weapon appearing to be made from a spinal column. You are considered proficient with this weapon and it uses your spellcasting modifier for both attack and damage rolls, the spear itself doing 1d8 piercing damage
If the material component used for the casting of this spell is the correct bone but from a humanoid subject then this spell no longer requires concentration.

When you cast this spell you conjure forth a bow like weapon appearing to be made from the limb bones of some creature. You are considered proficient with this weapon and it uses your spellcasting modifier for both attack and damage rolls the bow itself doing 1d8 piercing damage, additionally when conjured the bow does come with a quiver of 1d4+ Your spellcasting mod arrows
If the material component used for the casting of this spell is the correct bone but from a humanoid subject then this spell no longer requires concentration.

setters.set: A Limb bone from any creature.

description.p: When you cast this spell you conjure forth a shield appearing to be made from a bones. You are considered proficient with this shield and gain the normal +2 benefit to you AC.
If the material component used for the casting of this spell is the correct bone but from a humanoid subject then this spell no longer requires concentration.

When you cast this spell you conjure forth a skeletal version of the creature the bone used for the material component of this spell came from, it has the stats of that creature but it considered undead and is bonded to you for the duration of the spell to be used as a mount, if you are not proficient in mounted combat you are treated as if you are while mounted on this creature.

setters.set: Any bone from a creature that would be a suitable mount for a character of your size class.

description.p: After you cast this spell for the remainder of its duration whenever you would cast a necromancy spell, that would normally do necrotic damage to a target or targets, it instead heals them for the rolled amount.
You cast this spell by making a ranged spell attack roll against an ally creature within range. On a hit the target regains 1d6 + You INT modifier hit points
If the spell slot used for the casting of this spell is of second level or higher then the healing effect is increased by 1d6 per spell level.

When you cast this spell you are enabled with the ability to have uo to 2 concentration spells active at one time for the spell's duration, however if you would be made to make a constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on either spell you fail the save automatically and this spell comes to an early end.

setters.set: A piece of brain matter from any creature.

description.p: When you cast this spell you conjure forth a Swarm of Animated Books. The stat block for the Swarm of Animated Books is found on page 19 of Candlekeep Adventures. The Swarm uses for INT modifier for attack and damage rolls and takes its turn immediately after you in the turn order.
If the book used as the material component of this spell contained any spells intself then the summoned creature gains the ability to cast magic missile as an action on its turn.

setters.set: A book of at least 50 pages in length.

description.p: When you cast this spell you gain the ability to see in both magical and non magical darkness for a distance equal to 120 feet.

When you cast this spell you become both invisible and intangible. You gain the ability to pass through any solid object and have a set movement speed of 30 feet. When this spell ends you are returned to the original location that you cast the spell. This spell ends early if you cast a spell, take the attack action, or interact with any solid objects other than passing through them.

When you cast you can touch any weapon and imbue it with holy light. The effected weapon emits dim light and does an additional 1d4 radiant damage. An additional 1d4 radiant damage is added if the weapon effected by this spell is being used to make an attack against a fiend or an undead creature.
If the spell lot used for this spell is of 3rd level or higher the effect may be granted to one additional target for each spell slot level used over 2nd.

When you cast this spell you target an axe of any sort within range. The axe immediately has an aura of flame emit from the blade that doesnt seem hot to the touch. For the spell's duration the target axe emits a glow of dim light and when used for a sucessful melee weapon attack the axe does an additional 1d6 fire damage and 1d6 radiant damage.
If higher level spell slots are used for this spells casting then the effect damage is increased by 1d4 each for each spell slot over 2nd level used.

You concentrate your Pscionic presence into a psychic wave eminating from your body. All hostile targets within the area of effect must succeed an intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer from a migraine that causes disadvantage on all non physical based savings throw for the duration of the spell.
At 5th, 11th, and 17th levels the area of effect of the spell is increased by 5ft in each direction at each interval.

taking a piece of flammable material you concentrate your pscionic prowess to ignite this material and you throw it at a target in range using your spell modifier for the attack roll. on a successful hit the target takes 1d4 fire damage and 1d4 psychic damage.
. you can upcast this spell using 3rd, 5th, 7th, or 9th levels to increase the damage die by one each for the upcasting.. 3rd being 2 each, 5th being 3 each and so on and so forth

setters.set: A piece of flammable material that can be thrown.

description.p: Using the brain of an animal you conjure forth an Intellect Devourer and bind it to your service for 4 hours. The Intellect Devourer uses the stat block from the monster manual and moves and attacks on your turn.

You and a willing sentient creature perform the ritual together in which you form a temporary psychic bond. For the duration of the spell you and the melded target can speak telepathically and share a field of vision if both sides agree to it.

setters.set: A hair from the intended target.

description.p: You concentrate your power into your Mind's Eye, doing so improves all of your sensory perception. For the duration of the spell you can add your intelligence modifer to any perception, insight, and investigation skill checks. If this spell is upcast using a 2nd level spell slot for the duration of the spell you know if someone is lying to you.

You cause a target within range to make an intellgence saving throw against your spell save DC, on a fail the target becomes trapped in their own mind stuck in a vision seeing themselves chained and bound. For the duration of the spell or until the target takes damage the target is considered restrained.

You clear your mind and foresee an attack that is coming to you and you know what actions you need to take to avoid it. If you would be hit by an attack before the spell ends you can chose to use your reaction to have the attack miss you altogether. Once you have done this the spell's effect ends.

setters.set: A silk cloth worth at least 50 gp.

description.p: You foresee an ill omen befalling one of your allies and feel the need to warn them. You target an ally within range and the next time that ally would make a save to avoid damage/take less damage they have advantage on said save due to the foresight you have imparted.

element.name: Fireproof
element.prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Fire as the chosen damage type.

p.i: Prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Fire as the chosen damage type.

description.p: When you gain this feat, you attunement to the Flames becomes more developed.

You gain immunity to fire damage but only from spells and spell based effects, such as the fire damage rolled from an enemy's fireball spell or an item that was set aflame by magical fire. Real flames however will cause you to take fire damage, in this case any other resistances or immunities you have may be applied.

element.name: Hydrophobic
element.prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Cold as the chosen damage type.

p.i: Prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Cold as the chosen damage type.

description.p: When you gain this feat, you attunement to the Cold becomes more developed.

You gain immunity to cold damage but only from spells and spell based effects, such as the cold damage rolled from an enemy's cone of cold spell or an item that was frozen by magical cold. Real water and cold winds like a tidal wave or blizzard however will cause you to take cold damage, in this case any other resistances or immunities you have may be applied.

element.name: Soundproof
element.prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Thunder as the chosen damage type.

p.i: Prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Thunder as the chosen damage type.

description.p: When you gain this feat, you attunement to the Thunderous forces becomes more developed.

You gain immunity to thunder damage but only from spells and spell based effects, such as the thunder damage rolled from an enemy's thunderstep spell. Real Thunder or Sound based damage effects however will cause you to take thunder damage, in this case any other resistances or immunities you have may be applied.

element.name: Insulated
element.prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Lightning as the chosen damage type.

p.i: Prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Lightning as the chosen damage type.

description.p: When you gain this feat, you attunement to Lightning becomes more developed.

You gain immunity to lightning damage but only from spells and spell based effects, such as the lightning damage rolled from an enemy's lightning spell. Real Lightning or other forms of electricity however will cause you to take lightning damage, in this case any other resistances or immunities you have may be applied.

element.name: Impervious
element.prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Acid as the chosen damage type.

p.i: Prerequisite: Level 10, Elemental Adept Feat with Acid as the chosen damage type.

description.p: When you gain this feat, you attunement to Corrosion becomes more developed.

You gain immunity to acid damage but only from spells and spell based effects, such as the acid damage rolled from an enemy's melf's acid arrow spell.. Real acid or other corrosive materials however will cause you to take acid damage, in this case any other resistances or immunities you have may be applied.

element.name: Lore Seeker
element.prerequisite: Magic Initiate feat (with Bard as the chosen spell list), Charisma score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Prerequisite: Magic Initiate Feat (with Bard as the chosen spell list), Charisma score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you become more aware of the Arcane power of music and rhyme. You gain 1 Magical Secret ( A spell from any class spell list of a level that you can cast) and 2 Bardic Inspiration die.

If you are a Bard or have the Actor or Entertainer backgrounds then you can take this Feat without having to have taken the Magic Initiate Feat first, but you still must meet the Charisma score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Moonbound
element.prerequisite: Magic Initiate feat (with Druid as the chosen spell list), Wisdom score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Prerequisite: Magic Initiate Feat (with Druid as the chosen spell list), Wisdom score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you become more aware of the Natural magic that flows in the world around you. You gain the ability to use the Wild Shape feature, you can use this ability to transform yourself into any CR 0 creature for 1 minute a number of times a day equal to your Wisdom Modifier ( Min. 1 Max. 3). Other benefits and limitations of the Wild Shape feature apply as normal.

If you are a Druid, Oath of the Ancients Paladin, Nature Domain Cleric, Path of the Totem, or Beast Master Ranger you can take this Feat without having to have taken the Magic Initiate Feat first, but you still must meet the Wisdom score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Ordained
element.prerequisite: Magic Initiate feat (with Cleric as the chosen spell list), Wisdom score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Prerequisite: Magic Initiate Feat (with Cleric as the chosen spell list), Wisdom score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you become more aware of the Divine presence all around you. You gain 1 use of the Turn Undead feature once per day and 2 1st level spells from the Cleric spell list. These spells can be cast once before a long rest without need of a spell lot, however if you have spell slots of the appropriate level for casting of these spells you may use them

if you are an Aasimar, a Cleric, Paladin, Celestial Pact Warlock, or Divine Soul Sorcerer you can take this Feat without having to have taken the Magic Initiate Feat first, but you still must meet the Wisdome score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Eldritch Gift
element.prerequisite: Magic Initiate feat (with Warlock as the chosen spell list), Charisma score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Prerequisite:Magic Initiate Feat(with Warlock as the chosen spell list), Charisma score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat an Eldritch creature has taken note of you imitating its power, and is impressed. it bestows upon you a fraction of its power. You gain 1 Warlock Invocation from that list that does not have a prerequisite and you pick one of the Pact Boons to be bestowed upon you. You may change your Pact Boon each time you gain a new level.

if you are a Warlock or an Order of the Profane Soul Blood Hunter then you can take this Feat withouth having to have taken the Magic Initiate Feat first, but you still must meet the Charisma score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Epiphany
element.prerequisite: Magic Initiate feat (with Wizard as the chosen spell list), Intelligence score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Prerequisite:Magic Initiate Feat(with Wizard as the chosen spell list),Intelligence score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you learn to draw power from the weave more proficiently. A number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier (Min. 1 Max. 3) You can impose disadvantage on the target(s) effected by your spell or you can grant advantage one one of your own ranged spell attack rolls. You learn 1 cantrip and 2 1st level spells from the wizard spell list of your choice, you can cast each of the 1st level spells once between long rest without spell slots, but if you have the appropriate spell slots they can be cast using them as well.

if you are a Wizard, Eldritch Knight Fighter, Arcane Trickster Rogue, or Arcana Domain Cleric you can take this Feat without having had taken the Magic Initiate Feat first, but you still must meet the Intelligence score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Artificer Adept
element.prerequisite: Artificer Initiate Feat, Intelligence score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Prerequisite: Artificer Initiate Feat, Intelligence score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you gain more of an understanding on tinkering and crafting. You pick 2 Artificer Infusions from the Artificer Infusion table that do not have a prerequisite, these infusions can be applied under their normal rulings.

if you are an Artificer, a Warforged, or a Clockwork Soul Sorcerer you can take this Feat without having had taken the Artificer Initiate Feat first, but you still must meet the Intelligence score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion

element.name: Divine Rite
element.prerequisite: Inspiring Leader Feat, Charisma score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Inspiring Leader Feat, Charisma score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you are imbued with the radiance of a Divine being. A number of times per day equal to your Charisma modifier (Min.1 Max. 3) when you make a sucessful melee weapon attack you can invoke that God's radiance and add 1d8 radiant or necrotic damage to your damage roll, at 10th level this becomes 2d8 additional damage

if you are an Aasimar, a Paladin, a Cleric, Divine Soul Sorcerer, or Celestial Pact Warlock you can take this Feat without having had taken the Inspiring Leader Feat first, but you still must meet the Charisma score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Battle Lust
element.prerequisite: Savage Attacker Feat, Constitution score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Savage Attacker Feat, Constitution score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you learn how to manifest your anger as power on the field of battle. Twice per day you can use the Rage feature while in combat. This feature remains active for 1d4 rounds of combat and when the effect ends you take 1d4 pyschic damage. Other benefits and limitations of the Rage feature apply as they normally would

if you are a Barbarian, Oath of Vengeance Paladin, War Domain Cleric, or a Hex Blade Patron Warlock you can take this Feat without having had taken the Savage Attacker Feat first, but you still must meet the Constitution score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: White Belt
element.prerequisite: Mobile Feat, Wisdome score of 13 or higher

p.i: Mobile Feat, Wisdome score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you learn how to more adequately use your body in combat. You gain 2 Ki points and access to the Flurry of Blows and Patient Defense features. These Ki points replenish after a long rest. Your unarmed strikes now deal 1d6 + either your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). If you were already proficient in the Unarmed Combat Fighting Style (but not a Monk) then you instead deal 1d8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on Unarmed Stikes.

if you are a Monk, Battle Master Fighter, College of Valor Bard, or an Oath of Glory Paladin you can take this Feat without having had taken the Mobile Feat first, but you still must meet the Wisdom score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Sucker Punch
element.prerequisite: Skulker Feat, Dexterity score of 13 or higher

p.i: Skulker Feat, Dexterity score of 13 or higher

description.p: When you take this Feat you become more proficient at dealing damage to opponents when they are distracted or not looking at all. Whenever you would make a melee or ranged attack against a target that you either have advantage against or that is currently considered flanked you can add 1d6 additonal damage ( of the weapons damage type) to your damage roll. This damage increases to 2d6 at 10th level. You can use this feature a number of times per day equeal to your Dexterity Modifier (Min. 1 Max. 3)

if you are a Rogue, a Gloomstalker Ranger, a Way of the Shadow Monk, or a Trickery Domain Cleric you can take this Feat without having had taken the Skulker Feat first, but you still must meet the Dexterity requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Experienced
element.prerequisite: Observant Feat, Wisdom or Dexterity score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Observant Feat, Wisdom or Dexterity score of 13 or higher.

description.p: When you take this Feat you start to realize just how familiar you've become with the different types of foes one can encounter on the path. Twice per day you can use an action to declare a enemy type, this enemy type now becomes your favored enemy and gain all the benefits and limitations that would apply. This effect last for a minute. You may also cast the Hunter's Mark spell once between rests without using a spell slot.

if you are a Ranger, Druid, Knowledge Domain Cleric, Assassin rogue, or Battle Master Fighter you can take this Feat without having had taken the Observant Feat first, but you still must meet the Wisdom or Dexterity score requirement. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the Magic Initiate prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

A number of times per day equal to your Proficiency modifier (Min. 1 Max. 3) whenever you would make a skill check with a skill or tool that you are not proficient in but still have a bonus to because of your ability score modifier you gain advantage on that skill or tool check.

element.name: In Practice
element.prerequisite: In Theroy Feat.

p.i: Prerequisite: In Theory Feat.

description.p: A number of times per day equal to your Proficiency modifier (Min. 1 Max. 3) whenever you would make a skill check with a skill or tool that you proficient in you gain advantage on that skill or tool check
Whenever dealing with animals you have advantage on Intimidation checks to have them fear you or on animal handling checks to deal with the animals.
At 10th level you can cast speak with animals once per day without needing spell slots or material components, if you have the appropriate spell slots for casting you can also cast it this way.

element.name: Juggernaut
element.prerequisite: Charger Feat or Barbarian Class

p.i: Prerequisite: Charger Feat or Barbarian Class.

description.p: Whenever you take the dash action oppurtunity attacks made against you have are made with disadvantage, and oppurtunity attacks that do hit only do half damage.
Whenever you reach 10th level you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

element.name: Street Magician
element.prerequisite: Level 6 or higher, Non-spellcasting base class.

p.i: Prerequisite: Level 6 or higher, Non-spellcasting base class.

description.p: Whenever you take this feat you take this Feat you realize that you have a real knack that for complex magic tricks and simple spells. You gain proficiency in both the Sleight of Hand and Performance skills if you did not already have it. You then choose any 5 non damage dealing cantrips, these are now spells you can cast. If any of the chosen cantrips require a saving thrw against your DC, Charisma is used to calculate your DC.

element.name: Gift of Gab
element.prerequisite: Linguist Feat, Charisma score of 13 or higher.

p.i: Prerequisite: Linguist Feat, Charisma score of 13 or higher.

description.p: You realize how to capitilize on your gift for both language and conversation. You learn to speak, read, and write one additional language of your choice. Additionally, you can communicate in basic ways with anyone who can hear or see you. Whenever you make a deception or persuasion check against someone who speaks at least one language you do you gain advantage on that skill check.

element.name: In the Palm of Your Hand
element.prerequisite: Level 10

p.i: Prerequisite: Level 10

description.p: You gain advantage on Death Saving Throws.

select.name: In the Palm of Your Hand
select.supports: In the Palm of Your Hand

element.name: Profit
element.prerequisite: Bard Class or Entertainer Background

p.i: Prerequisite: Bard Class or Entertainer Background

description.p: You gain Profit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus, these points replenish after a long rest. Whenever you would recieve money as a form of payment or tips from a Non-player Character you can spend 1 of your Profit Points to roll 2d10, the total amount rolled is added to the payment you recieved. The additional amount you recieve corresponds to the type of currency you recieved in your original payment, if you were being paid in copper pieces then you will recieve additional copper pieces but if it's gold pieces you were paid in then the additional amount will also be in gold pieces.

element.name: Falconeer
element.prerequisite: Proficiency in the Animal Handling Skill, Wisdom or Charisma score of 13 or higher

p.i: Prerequisite: Proficiency in the Animal Handling Skill, Wisdom or Charisma score of 13 or higher

description.p: You gain a Falcon as an Animal Companion, at your DM's discretion this could be substituted with any other Bird of Prey, and how you came upon this bird can be discussed by you and your DM. The bird stat block can be found in the Monster Manual. This bird can be used in combat like a normal Animal Companion but you can also use can also use your bird to assist you in foraging or hunting, via giving you advantage on Nature or Survival Skill checks used in the gathering of Food. The bird can also be used to deliver messages to any village, town, or city that it has spent at least 3 days in and has been given a place to use as it's desired landing point.

element.name: Totem Bearer
element.prerequisite: Wisdom score of 13 or higher, Constitution score of 13 or higher

p.i: Prerequisite: Wisdom score of 13 or higher, Constitution score of 13 or higher

description.p: When you take this Feat you choose one of the Totem Spirits presented and you gain all benefits associated with it.

if you are a Path of the Totem Barbarian, Nature Domain Cleric, Circle of the Moon Druid, Oath of the Ancients Paldain, or a Beast Master Ranger You can take this feat while only meeting one of the Ability score requirements. *Any third party/homebrew classes or subclasses can be added to the list of exemptions from the ability score prerequisite at the DM's discretion.

You gain a Darkvision of 60 feet if you did not already have it. If you already had Darkvision your distance you can see with it is doubled. If you already had Darkvision and are of a Class considered to be a full caster, you gain the ability to see in magical darkness.

sheet.description: You gain a Darkvision of 60 feet if you did not already have it. If you already had Darkvision your distance you can see with it is doubled. If you already had Darkvision and are of a Class considered to be a full caster, you gain the ability to see in magical darkness.

description.p: You gain a permenant +2 your AC that applies with or without armor equipped, your swim speed is increased by 10 feet, and the rate at which you age is halved.

sheet.description: You gain a permenant +2 your AC that applies with or without armor equipped, your swim speed is increased by 10 feet, and the rate at which you age is halved.

description.p: Your standing jumps are treated as running jumps. You can use a bonus action to secrete a posionous substance from your hands, if another creature touches this substance they must make a constitution saving throw or be posioned. Creatures can repeat this saving throw at the end of their turn. Your DC for this save is calculated using your Wisdom modifier.

sheet.description: Your standing jumps are treated as running jumps. You can use a bonus action to secrete a posionous substance from your hands, if another creature touches this substance they must make a constitution saving throw or be posioned. Creatures can repeat this saving throw at the end of their turn. Your DC for this save is calculated using your Wisdom modifier.

description.p: Your Dexterity score is increased by 1 and you gain expertise in acrobatics checks if you did not already have it. You grow a prehensile tail that can be used to grasp, grab or hold most things your hands could hold but it cannot be used to hold and use weapons other than daggers.

sheet.description: Your Dexterity score is increased by 1 and you gain expertise in acrobatics checks if you did not already have it. You grow a prehensile tail that can be used to grasp, grab or hold most things your hands could hold but it cannot be used to hold and use weapons other than daggers.

element.name: Runewright
element.prerequisite: Linguist Feat, Constitution score of 13 or higher

p.i: Prerequisite: Linguist Feat, Constitution score of 13 or higher

description.p: When you take this Feat you have come to understand the Old Runes of the Giants and the magic they hold,choose two of the Runes from the Rune Knight Rune list and you gain all benefits associated with them.

If you are a Dwarf, Gnome, or Goliath you can take this Feat without having had taken the Linguist Feat first, but you still must meet the Constitution score requirement. Rune Knight Fighters do not recieve access to this Feat.

element.name: Haug (Hill Rune)
element.source: Unearthed Arcana: Fighter, Ranger, and Rogue

description.p: This rune’s magic bestows a resilience reminiscent of a hill giant. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance against poison damage.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. Once you invoke the rune, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance against poison damage. In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute.

element.name: Ild (Fire Rune)
element.source: Unearthed Arcana: Fighter, Ranger, and Rogue

description.p: This rune’s magic channels the masterful craftsmanship of fire giant smiths. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your proficiency with a tool.

In addition, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can invoke the rune to summon fiery shackles: the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. While restrained by the shackles, the target takes 2d6 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the shackles on a success. Once you invoke the rune, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your proficiency with a tool. In addition, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can invoke the rune to summon fiery shackles: the target must succeed on a DC {{rune knight:rune magic:dc}} Strength saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. While restrained by the shackles, the target takes 2d6 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the shackles on a success.

element.name: Ise (Frost Rune)
element.source: Unearthed Arcana: Fighter, Ranger, and Rogue

description.p: This rune’s magic evokes a frost giant’s stoic calm. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks and Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action to increase your Strength score by 2 for 10 minutes. This increase can cause your score to exceed 20, but not 30. Once you invoke the rune, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Animal Handling checks and Intimidation checks. In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action to increase your Strength score by 2 for 10 minutes. This increase can cause your score to exceed 20, but not 30.

element.name: Skye (Cloud Rune)
element.source: Unearthed Arcana: Fighter, Ranger, and Rogue

description.p: This rune’s magic emulates the deceptiveness of a cloud giant. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks and Charisma (Deception) checks.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to invoke the rune and cause that attack to target a different creature within 30 feet of you (other than the attacker), using the same roll. This magic can transfer the attack regardless of the attack’s range. Once you invoke the rune, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Sleight of Hand checks and Deception checks. In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to invoke the rune and cause that attack to target a different creature within 30 feet of you (other than the attacker), using the same roll. This magic can transfer the attack regardless of the attack’s range.

element.name: Stein (Stone Rune)
element.source: Unearthed Arcana: Fighter, Ranger, and Rogue

description.p: This rune’s magic channels the insightfulness of a stone giant. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks, and you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.

In addition, when a creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to invoke the rune and force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature is charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has a speed of 0 and is incapacitated, descending into a dreamy stupor. The effect ends if the charmed creature takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its haze. Once you invoke the rune, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Insight checks, and you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet. In addition, when a creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to invoke the rune and force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature is charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has a speed of 0 and is incapacitated, descending into a dreamy stupor. The effect ends if the charmed creature takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its haze.

element.name: Uvar (Storm Rune)
element.source: Unearthed Arcana: Fighter, Ranger, and Rogue

description.p: Using this rune, you can glimpse the future like a storm giant. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks, and you can’t be surprised as long as you are not incapacitated.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action to enter a prophetic state for 1 minute or until you’re incapacitated. Until the state ends, when you or another creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, you can use your reaction to cause the roll to have advantage or disadvantage. Once you invoke the rune, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Arcana checks, and you can’t be surprised as long as you are not incapacitated. In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action to enter a prophetic state for 1 minute or until you’re incapacitated. Until the state ends, when you or another creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, you can use your reaction to cause the roll to have advantage or disadvantage.
